column4: Does anyone in this channel have a suggestion as to why uncommenting %sudo ALL=NOPASSWD: ALL would NOT enable no-password use of sudo?
Using the method which is built-into the /etc/sudoers file.
I don't even know if it hides them from you in GUI mode either, does it? Konqueror/Nautilus/Dolphin don't seem to.
Normally, no it doesn't.  But it *can*.
As long as they can talk to each other.
As I said -- I don't *think* it matters what ssh server you're working with.
(if something else hasn't decided it's going to use it)
sudo su - is my friend too.
You just reminded me of how many times I destroyed my boot partition when setting up my multibooting USB drive.
I've got a multibooting USB drive with 3 *.iso files and memtest on it.
I'm trying to add PCRegedit to it.
It's a Linux-based LiveCD meant to correct Windows registries.
Ubuntu & Backtrack 4 I've already got booting.  It's just PCRegedit I'm after.
